1.text: And quickly the chief priests having made counsel with the more ancient and scribes and the whole council, having bound Jesus, led away, and delivered to Pilate.

2.text: And Pilate asked him, Art thou the King of the Jews? And having answered, he said to him, Thou sayest.

3.text: And the chief priests accused him much.

4.text: And Pilate again asked him, saying, Answerest thou nothing? behold how much they accuse thee.

5.text: And Jesus yet answered nothing; so that Pilate wondered.

6.text: And at the festival he loosed to them one in bonds, whomsoever they asked.

7.text: And there was he called Barabbas, bound with those exciting sedition, who did murder in the revolt.

8.text: And the crowd having cried, began to ask as he did always to them.

9.text: And Pilate answered them, saying, Will ye I loose to you the King of the Jews?

10.text: For he knew that through envy the chief priests had delivered him up:

11.text: And the chief priests moved the crowd, that he would rather loose Barabbas to them.

12.text: And Pilate having answered, again said to them, What then will ye I should do to him whom ye call King of the Jews?

13.text: And again they cried out, Crucify him.

14.text: And Pilate said to them, But what evil has he done? And they cried out more excessively, Crucify him.

15.text: And Pilate, willing to satisfy the crowd, loosed to them Barabbas, and delivered Jesus, having scourged, that he might be crucified.

16.text: And the soldiers led him away within the hall, which is the Pretorium; and they call together the whole band.

17.text: And they clothed him with purple, and put round him, having woven, a thorny crown.

18.text: And they began to greet him, Hail, O King of the Jews.

19.text: And they struck his head with a reed, and they spit upon him, and having placed the knees, they worshipped him.

20.text: And when they mocked him, they put off the purple from him, and clothed him with his own garments, and led him out that they might crucify him.

21.text: And they constrain a certain Simon, a Cyrenian, passing by, coming from the field, the father of Alexander and Rufus, that he might take up his cross.

22.text: And they bring him to the place Golgotha, which is, interpreted, The place of a skull.

23.text: And they gave him wine to drink, prepared with myrrh: and he took not.

24.text: And having crucified him, they divided his garments, casting lots upon what any should take up.

25.text: And it was the third hour, and they crucified him:

26.text: And the inscription of his accusation was inscribed above, THE KING OF THE JEWS.

27.text: And with him they crucify two robbers; one from the right, and one from the left.

28.text: And the writing was completed, saying, And he was reckoned with the lawless.

29.text: And they going by blasphemed him, shaking their heads, and saying, Ah, thou loosing the temple, and building in three days,

30.text: Save thyself, and come down from the cross.

31.text: And likewise also the chief priests, mocking to one another with the scribes, said, He saved others; himself he cannot save.

32.text: Let Christ, King of Israel, come down from the cross, that we might see and believe. And they crucified with him reproached him.

33.text: And being the sixth hour, darkness was upon the whole earth till the ninth hour.

34.text: And at the ninth hour Jesus cried with a great voice, saying, Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani? which is, being interpreted, My God, my God, for what hast thou forsaken me?

35.text: And some of them standing by, having heard, said, Behold, he calls Elias.

36.text: And one running and having filled a sponge with vinegar, and put round a reed, gave him to drink, saying, Let alone; let us see if Elias will come to take him down.

37.text: And Jesus having let go a great voice, expired.

38.text: And the veil of the temple was split in two from above to below.

39.text: And the centurion, standing over against him, having seen that having so cried out he expired, said, Truly this man was the Son- of God.

40.text: And women also were beholding from far: among whom was Mary Magdalene, and Mary of James the small and the mother of Joses, and Salome;

41.text: (And they, when he was in Galilee, followed him and served him;) and many other women, having come up with him to Jerusalem.

42.text: And being already evening, for it was the preparation, which is before sabbath,

43.text: Joseph came from Arimathea, a distinguished counsellor, who also himself was expecting the kingdom of God, having ventured, he went in to Pilate, and asked for the body of Jesus.

44.text: And Pilate wondered if he were already dead: and having called the centurion, he asked him if he had been dead long ago.

45.text: And having known from the centurion, he bestowed the body to Joseph.

46.text: And having bought fine linen, and taken him down, he rolled in fine linen, and placed him in a tomb, which was quarried out of a rock, and he rolled a stone at the door of the tomb.

47.text: And Mary Magdalene and Mari of Joses were beholding where he is laid.
